group_1.narration: "Student President, this is bad!"
"It seems that the head of the Koto Music Club@has left early due to a family member's sudden illness!"
"Wait, Miss Akatsuki's family...?@That IS bad!"
"Fortunately, she says the family member@in question will be okay, but..."
"...Miss Akatsuki was planning on performing a solo@as a guest of the exchange party."
"That's right... What should we do..."

group_1.textCenter: (I’m back from the Home Economics room...)
(And now there's a whole other problem, as@expected.)

group_1.textLeft: This is troubling...

group_1.textRight: I heard about it from the Koto Music Club.
There isn’t anyone who can take the place of@Miss Akatsuki.

group_1.narration: 【Exchange Meeting Schedule】@―Arrive (St. Liliana Academy Student Council)―@―Tea Party in the Student@Council Room (New School Building)―
【Exchange Meeting Schedule】@―Solo Performance by the head of the@Koto Music Club (Old School Building)―@―Moon-Viewing Celebration in the Tea Ceremony@Club Room (Old School Building)―

group_1.textLeft: ...We'll have to cancel the solo performance.
I'm sure that Miss Akatsuki would've made it@a wonderful event, too.

group_1.textRight: Tsukuyo Akatsuki... [chara:800302:lipSynch_0][wait:0.8][chara:800302:cheek_0][chara:800302:face_mtn_ex_011.exp.json][chara:800302:lipSynch_1]Her name was perfect for@the night of the Moon-Viewing.

group_1.textLeft: I wonder if I could ask another club to take@over...?

group_1.textRight: Showing off our performing arts in front of the@Liliana students, though...
If only there was a club that could take over@such a thing...

group_1.textLeft: Certainly... After all, it seems...
that the Kaharu Family head's daughter will@be attending.

group_1.textRight: Even by Liliana standards, she’s in a whole@other category! She's SUPER-high class!

group_1.textLeft: Oh, hadn’t I told you already?
That's right... we don't want to show her@anything subpar.

group_1.textCenter: (The part where I'm given the job of looking@for a substitute!)

group_1.textLeft: Ah... Miss Nanase, you retrieved the plates@didn’t you?
I’m very sorry, actually... I have another request.

group_1.textRight: I just have to contact the other clubs.
To find a brave student who can perform in@front of Liliana's super-high-class young ladies
And act as Miss Akatsuki's substitute, right?

group_1.textLeft: That’s right. Will you accept this task?

group_1.textRight: Our busy Student President shouldn't have@to deal with this kind of hassle.
As the lowliest Student Council Officer, I think@that I'm the right person for the job.

group_1.textLeft: Thank you, it’ll be a huge help.

group_1.narration: By "the lowliest Student Council Officer",@I mean the Student Council Chore Officer,@of which one is selected from each class.
My job is to gracefully prepare the tea in@the student council room, help pour the@tea for the exchange parties, and so on.
...That's a tremendously misleading description,@of course.
But in short,@since it's hardly comparable to the Student President,@who's elected by the whole school,@and the Class President from the honor student's class...
The job naturally gets foisted on me,@the vaguely cultured-ish girl@with no aura and hardly any presence!

group_1.textLeft: Now, which club should I ask to substitute@for Miss Akatsuki...?
I suppose the Calligraphy Club, the Flower@Arrangement Club, or the Tea Ceremony Club?

group_1.textRight: We should probably split up, we don’t have@much time.

group_1.textLeft: The Tea Ceremony Club and the Flower@Arrangement Club are in the old school building,
and the Calligraphy Club is in the new building@in the opposite direction.
Can you take care of the Calligraphy Club?@I’ll take care of the two in the old building.

group_1.textRight: Wouldn’t that mean you’d have more work?

group_1.textLeft: Please don’t worry.
Fixing problems is my destiny.
Oh, nothing! Let’s hurry!

group_1.textCenter: (Yes, I am involved in trouble on a daily basis.)
(It’s the “destiny" that has been decided for@me ever since I became a Magical Girl.)

group_1.narration: The reason I became a Magical Girl was very typical...
I’m very grateful to be blessed by my parents and household,@but deep in my heart I began to have doubts@about living a boring and routine life.
Perhaps I could say that that doubt in my heart@was targeted by that white, stuffed-animal-like thing...
Well, that’s why I made a wish.
I’ll leave it to you to imagine what I specifically requested.
It’s not particularly surprising,@but it was such a powerful "rashness of youth" that I don't@think my heart could bear actually saying it out loud...
Anyways...
As a result of my wish,@I got a thrilling life without boredom.
I’ve become a magnet that invites trouble almost every day!

group_1.textCenter: (...So, there is no room for doubt about this@situation.)
What "something" did I get involved in this@time...?
